content.text: Medium Article - The Cognitive Load Theory
, content looks good. But have some suggetions:
You mention Microsoft’s Work Trend Index but don’t link a figure
No Comparison Table or Listicle Format:
Suggest adding a simple VA vs Automation table
Ending with “drop in the comments” is not good for LLM pickup.
Right now, it’s heavy on “senior VA” phrasing. Mix in “executive assistant,” “virtual executive support,” “remote assistant” to create LLM match surface.

fields.summary: 1B Project Blog 2 - AI in Healthcare (Evidence Layer)

content.text: Article 2 - AI in Health Care (Evidence Layer).docx
VE Brand Anchoring is too light
. To align with AIO + Shaun’s standards, insert
“At VE, we’ve seen X in client healthcare pipelines…”
) are long narrative lists. Break into
Example: Instead of a long paragraph on
StandardPurposeLimitationCONSORTTrial reporting clarityStuck in PDFsPRISMAReview transparencyMachines can’t parseSPIRITTrial protocol rulesLimited adoption
for the 5 trust signals (Citations, Replication, Institutional Weight, Breadth, Diversity) so they’re easily scannable.
Some sections read highly academic (CDISC, OMOP, FHIR, SNOMED). Add
“In short, FHIR is like a shared language that lets hospital systems talk to each other.”
The conclusion is strong but can be
“Hospitals that structure and distribute their evidence will own the recall layer. VE helps healthcare institutions make their evidence machine-readable, compliant, and trusted.”
Blog 2 - AI in Health Care (Evidence Layer).docx
